content.text: The curve \(y = 2x^{2} + k + 4\) intersects the straight line \(y = (k + 4)x\) at two distinct points. Find the possible values of \(k\)
Find \(\mathrm{f}(x)\)
Write down the values of \(x\) such that \(\mathrm{f}(x) < 0\)
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\), where \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is a cubic polynomial
Write down the amplitude of \(2\cos \frac{x}{3} - 1.\)
Write down the period of \(2\cos \frac{x}{3} - 1.\)
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = 2\cos \frac{x}{3} - 1\) for \(-\pi \leqslant x \leqslant 3\pi\) radians
Find the common difference and the first term of the progression
Find the least number of terms of the progression for their sum to be negative
The 7th and 10th terms of an arithmetic progression are 158 and 149 respectively
Find the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(x - \frac{3}{x}\right)\left(x + \frac{2}{x}\right)^{5}\)
Given that the minimum value of \(x^{2} + 2x - 3\) occurs when \(x = -1\), explain why \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) has an inverse
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) and the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\). Label each graph and state the intercepts on the coordinate axes
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point where \(x = \sqrt{2}\)
Find the approximate change in \(y\) as \(x\) increases from \(\sqrt{2}\) to \(\sqrt{2} +h\), where \(h\) is small
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{\ln\left(3x^{2} - 5\right)}{2x + 1}\) for \(3x^{2} > 5\)
Find the number of ways in which 12 people can be put into 3 groups containing 3, 4 and 5 people respectively
there are no restrictions,
the number is even,
the number is greater than 7000 and odd
4-digit numbers are to be formed using four of the digits 2, 3, 7, 8 and 9. Each digit may be used once only in any 4-digit number. Find how many 4-digit numbers can be formed if
Show that

content.blockMath: \[\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{4(Ax + B)}{\sqrt{4x + 3}}, \quad \text{where } A \text{ and } B \text{ are constants.}\]

content.text: Hence write down the \(x\)-coordinate of the stationary point of the curve
Determine the nature of this stationary point
A curve has equation \(y = (2x - 1)\sqrt{4x + 3}\)
Given that \(\mathrm{p}(1) = - 2\mathrm{p}(0)\), find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(2x - 1\),
factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\)
Using your values of \(a\) and \(b\),
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 6x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx + 2\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers, has a factor of \(x - 2\)
Show that the perimeter of the shaded region is \((7.5 + 2 \sin 0.75)r\)
Find the area of the shaded region, giving your answer in the form \(kr^2\), where \(k\) is a constant correct to 2 decimal places
In this question all lengths are in centimetres and all angles are in radians

The diagram shows the rectangle \(ADEF\), where \(AF = DE = r\). The points \(B\) and \(C\) lie on \(AD\) such that \(AB = CD = r\). The curve \(BC\) is an arc of the circle, centre \(O\), radius \(r\) and has a length of \(1.5r\)
Find the value of \(V.\)
Write down the acceleration of \(P\) when \(t = 40\)
The diagram shows the velocitytime graph of a particle \(P\) that travels \(2775 \text{m}\) in \(90 \text{s}\), reaching a final velocity of \(V \text{ms}^{- 1}\)
Find the velocity of \(Q\) at time \(t\)
Find the displacement of \(Q\) from \(O\) at time \(t\)

The acceleration, \(a \mathrm{~m s}^{- 2}\) , of a particle \(Q\) travelling in a straight line, is given by \(a = 6 \cos 2t\) at time \(t \mathrm{~s}\). When \(t = 0\) the particle is at point \(O\) and is travelling with a velocity of \(10 \mathrm{~m s}^{- 1}\)
